content: BEIJING  April 6 China's Ant Financial tried to soothe security concerns about its proposed $880 million takeover MoneyGram International Inc on Thursday  saying it intends to store U.S. user data locally once the deal closes.
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: UPDATE 1-China's Ant seeks to allay MoneyGram security fears

content: WASHINGTON  March 28 Euronet Worldwide Inc  ramped up its fight against China's Ant Financial Services Group in trying to acquire MoneyGram International Inc   urging the U.S. government to closely scrutinize the rival Chinese bid saying it raises "significant national security risks."
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: MoneyGram bidder Euronet ramps up fight to stop Chinese rival's bid

content: March 19 U.S. electronic payments company MoneyGram International Inc will share confidential information with peer Euronet Worldwide Inc  after the latter made a $1 billion acquisition offer  according to people familiar with the matter.
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: MoneyGram to give Euronet confidential info to firm up bid-sources

content: March 20 U.S. electronic payments company MoneyGram International Inc said on Monday that peer Euronet Worldwide Inc's offer could result in a superior proposal compared to the one from China's Ant Financial Services Group.
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: MoneyGram board says Euronet offer could result in superior proposal

content: * Moneygram board of directors determines unsolicited proposal from Euronet Worldwide could reasonably be expected to result in a "company superior proposal"
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: BRIEF-Moneygram board says Euronet's proposal could be "company superior proposal"

content: U.S. electronic payments company Euronet Worldwide Inc  launched a $1 billion bid for rival MoneyGram International Inc  on Tuesday  arguing that its all-American deal would face less regulatory scrutiny than a lower bid by China's Ant Financial Services Group.
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: Euronet Worldwide trumps Ant Financial's offer to buy MoneyGram

content: March 14 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Tuesday:
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions

content: * Euronet deal would not require CFIUS clearance   (Adds MoneyGram comment)
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: UPDATE 6-Euronet Worldwide trumps Ant Financial's offer to buy MoneyGram

content: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Ant Financial's march may be worth slowing down. A $1 billion offer for MoneyGram from Euronet Worldwide improves on the deal it agreed earlier this year with the payments arm of Jack Ma's e-commerce colossus Alibaba. The interloper is in the rare position of having a couple of important advantages over the deep-pocketed Chinese entrepreneur.
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: Jack Ma's Ant march may be worth slowing

content: * Moneygram confirms receipt of unsolicited proposal from Euronet Worldwide
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: BRIEF-Moneygram confirms receipt of unsolicited proposal from Euronet Worldwide

content: March 14 U.S. electronics payments provider Euronet Worldwide Inc said on Tuesday it offered to buy money-transfer company MoneyGram International Inc for $15.20 per share  trumping Ant Financial's bid of $13.25 per share.
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: Euronet Worldwide trumps Ant Financial's offer to buy MoneyGram

content: * Euronet worldwide proposes to acquire moneygram for $15.20 per share
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: BRIEF-Euronet Worldwide proposes to acquire Moneygram for $15.20 per share

content: March 14 Ant Financial Services Group  the financial services affiliate of China's Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  said on Tuesday it remained committed to the consummation of its merger with U.S. money-transfer company MoneyGram International Inc  after Euronet Worldwide Inc  trumped its offer.
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: Ant Financial says it is committed to merger with MoneyGram

content: NEW YORK  Jan 19 HiFX  a UK-based foreign currency provider owned by Nasdaq-listed Euronet Worldwide   is going on an aggressive expansion in the United States and Canada over the next two years  Jeff Matheson  the company's managing director for North America  said in an interview late Friday.
name: Euronet Worldwide Inc
title: UK-based payments provider HiFX goes on aggressive U.S.  Canada push
